intro: Gleicheniastrum madagascariense, commonly known as the Madagascar spikemoss, is a member of the family Huperjiaceae and is native to Madagascar. It is a small, terrestrial moss-like plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a distinctive morphology with a prostrate stem and erect, spiky leaves that are often covered in a thick layer of rhizoids. It plays a role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
